alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Orange and northwestern Osceola Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Four Corners, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Ocoee, Winter Garden and Windermere. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
